CONCLUSION: Violation of Art. 6-1;Violation of Art. 8;Not necessary to examine P1-1;Pecuniary damage - financial award;Costs and expenses award - Convention proceedings
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in GPE , GPE .
CARDINAL . The applicant and her husband were holders of a specially protected tenancy on a flat in Split where they lived . On DATE they divorced and the husband left .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG threw the applicant out of the flat and moved in .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant filed an action against GPE for disturbance of her possessions with ORG ( PERSON ) .
CARDINAL . In separate proceedings before the same court , on DATE , the applicant obtained a judgment declaring her the sole holder of the specially protected tenancy on the flat .

CARDINAL . NORP In the proceedings against GPE on DATE the applicant 's claim was granted and the court ordered GPE to vacate the flat within DATE from DATE when the decision became final . It was established that ORG had forcefully broken into the applicant 's flat and had been living there without any legal ground . The decision became final on DATE .
CARDINAL . Given that ORG did not comply with the court 's order to vacate the flat , on DATE the applicant applied for the execution of the decision to ORG . The execution order was issued on DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG invited the applicant to pay an advance for the costs of eviction . On DATE the applicant informed the court that she had paid the costs .
CARDINAL . The court ordered the eviction for DATE . However , on that date the execution officer of the court established that the family PERSON occupied the flat .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant again asked the court to enforce the eviction order . The court scheduled eviction for DATE . However , the eviction was adjourned because the applicant did not appear .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant again asked the court to enforce the eviction order .
CARDINAL . On DATE the court invited the applicant to pay an advance for the costs of eviction .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant bought the flat and became its owner .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant informed the court that she had paid the costs .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant asked the court to speed up the proceedings .
CARDINAL . The court scheduled eviction for DATE .

CARDINAL . NORP However , on DATE and DATE , respectively ORG ( Hrvatska udruga vojnih invalida domovinskog rata ) and ORG Homeland War Veterans ( ORG hrvatskih branitelja PERSON ) asked the court to adjourn the eviction .

CARDINAL . When on DATE an eviction officer of ORG attempted to carry out the eviction order he found a number of war veterans obstructing his attempt . Despite the presence of the police the eviction order was not carried out .
CARDINAL . On DATE the court invited the applicant to once more pay an advance for the costs for eviction .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant informed the court that she had paid the costs .
CARDINAL . The next attempt to carry out the eviction order was scheduled for DATE , but it failed because a physician invited to assist did not appear .
CARDINAL . On DATE the court scheduled the date for eviction for DATE . However , the parties agreed that the family PERSON vacate the LOC DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE the family PERSON left the flat and the applicant moved in .
